title: Agbe
author: Agbe
created_time: February 13, 2025, 06:51:46 PMLast edit: February 13, 2025, 07:02:08 PM by Agbe
content: Don't Just Invest But Check Your Local Currency with the US dollar exchange rate first before investing.In the year 2023 when the new president came to the corridor of power, he changed many economic policies and it affect the dollar exchange rate in the country which made the dollar to rise and making the National Currency to devalued. And that made the early investors of bitcoin to made good profit coupled with the rise of Bitcoin from 2023 to 2024. The exchange rate of US dollar to NGN Naira as of 2013 to 2014 was $1 to N150 so those who invested or had bitcoin as of then made good profit as the price increase. In 2015 to 2022 the exchange rate of the US dollar with the local currency NGN Naira was $1 to N400 and N500 so those who had Bitcoin in the year 2013 to 2014 made good profit in the year 2015 to 2022. And in 2023 to 2024 US dollar to NGN Naira was $1 to N1,700 and those who invested in 2015 to 2022 made a maximum profit because the exchange rate was very high with US/NGN in 2023 to 2024. And those bitcoin investors were living good lives and helping people financially and materially to orphans and other needs. With that many people decided to invest in bitcoin at the time when the US/ NGN was high as $1- NGN1,700+ and many people invested in bitcoin and they were only looking at the bitcoin price to invest and not dollar to local currency. And those who invested at the time of $1 to NGN1,700+ is at the losing side because currently the exchange rate with the US dollar to the NGN Naira is $1 to N1,550 and it is coming down weekly so those who invested in 2024 will be at the losing side unless the dollar rise again. That is the risk.And why I create this thread is that don't only look at the price to invest in bitcoin but also the local exchange with the US dollar. These are some of the calculative risk involved in the bitcoin investment. It is good to know all these before venturing into the investment of bitcoin.DOLLAR VS NAIRA 1 USD = 150+ NGN in 20131 USD = 170+ NGN in 20141 USD = 199+ NGN in 20151 USD = 300+ NGN in 20161 USD = 359+ NGN in 20171 USD = 364+ NGN in 20181 USD = 363+ NGN in 20191 USD = 387+ NGN in 20201 USD = 411+ NGN in 20211 USD = 448+ NGN in 20221 USD = 773+ NGN in 20231 USD = 1,700+ NGN in 2024Image source: Here

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Local currencies are very unstable especially that of an underdeveloped country with bad government and bad leaders. If you want the determining factor on whether or not to own Bitcoin to be based on local currency you probably will not own any Bitcoin. Like it is said the best time to buy Bitcoin was years ago based on the price was low but the second best time is now same can apply to the local currency or any other currency. Don't base your Bitcoin aspirations on your local currency.

comments.body: And to summarize the story, bitcoin is the best option while you are investing. Even if we hold our asset on fiat currencies all have the inflation except the bitcoin.I will not say that there is no risk in Bitcoin investment, but I always say that investing a very small amount that will not have any impact on you if lost, But that should be regular and for the long term may 4,8,12years by making regular DCA. Of course, it would give you  back more when you will hold that for long term. And if it happens that you invest most of your income in Bitcoin for profit and do not keep anything for emergency situations later, then in your case the loss risk level will be high.But I just want to give an example. If we had been holding Bitcoin at the rate of 1 dollar per week since May 2013, the picture below shows what our current situation would be like:(I'm not talking about the future.)

comments.author: nelson4lov
comments.body: Rate matters but so does the Bitcoin price. Even though rate went to N2000 per $ but Bitcoin dumped, they would lose either way. But there's no way to make calculated risks when the rate and Bitcoin price is outside the scope of what the average individual can control.The only way I can see that will mitigate against risks like this is just to DCA in both. Dca into $ rate and DCA into bitcoin when both are in dips. If you just buy one lump sum, you might as well dig a hole for yourself.

comments.author: finaleshot2016
comments.body: Actually, you can never tell what will happen in an economy of a country, this just proves that you can't really predict what will happen next. The exchange rate can go up or down, and the same goes for Bitcoin. Some people made crazy profits because of timing, but others bought in at the wrong moment and lost value due to the exchange rate dropping. Investing isn’t just about BTC price, it's also about how your local currency moves against the USD. It's not something we anticipated, but for me, as long as you're invested in bitcoin, no matter what currency it is, it's really profitable.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: That's what inflation is all about. And we can fairly say that the US economy is what most of the countries are relying on. If they are hit by major inflation even for just 0.01% or 0.1% it's already big news just like what the US has reported recently. I agree to the concern of agbe and for everyone who's into investing whether it's on Bitcoin or any other markets and huge economies, it's important to look also on how your local currency is doing. It means a lot for someone who's into financial markets and even if we don't like it and we're not experts on it, we're forced to dive into it thanks to BTC.
